nodes.description: 2001年11月，Al-Qaeda恐怖分子在摩加迪沙首次会面，计划袭击肯尼亚以色列目标
nodes.support_text: In November 2001, the terrorists first met in Mogadishu, Somalia, to discuss a possible strike against Israeli interests in Kenya.

nodes.description: 2002年4月，恐怖分子确定以色列航空公司飞机和Paradise酒店为袭击目标
nodes.support_text: By April 2002, the terrorists had singled out the Israeli-owned aircraft and the Paradise Hotel as their targets.

nodes.description: 2002年5月至9月，恐怖分子通过闭路电视监控Paradise酒店周边环境
nodes.support_text: Over the next five months, the terrorists conducted video surveillance of the hotel’s grounds.

nodes.description: 2002年11月15日，恐怖分子购买绿色皮卡（Pajero）作为运输工具
nodes.support_text: The terrorists assembled the bombs in a rented house in Tudor, Mombasa. They packed the bombs into their SUV, which was bought on November 15, 2002.

nodes.description: 2002年底，恐怖分子在蒙巴萨Tudor出租屋组装爆炸装置
nodes.support_text: The terrorists assembled the bombs in a rented house in Tudor, Mombasa.

nodes.description: 2002年12月，恐怖分子从也门走私两枚苏联制SA-7B防空导弹至肯尼亚
nodes.support_text: They made arrangements to smuggle two shoulder-fired Soviet-made SA-7B SAMs into Kenya from Yemen.

nodes.description: 2003年8月40日，恐怖分子向以色列航空 Arkia Airlines发射SA-7B导弹未击中
nodes.support_text: At 8.40am that day, other terrorists fired a missile at an Israeli Arkia Airlines jet as it took off from Mombasa’s Moi International Airport.

nodes.description: 2003年8月40日，恐怖分子在Paradise酒店实施自杀式袭击，造成15人死亡
nodes.support_text: Suddenly, one of the men jumped out, slipped under the barrier, and ran towards the reception desk, detonating explosives that were strapped to his body.

nodes.description: 多国情报机构联合调查发现攻击筹备始于2001年11月
nodes.support_text: Investigations by American, Israeli, and Kenyan intelligence service teams into the hotel bombing revealed that preparations for the attack had started a year earlier.

nodes.description: 澳大利亚、英国、加拿大、美国等暂停驻肯使馆并发布旅行警告
nodes.support_text: Australia, Britain, Canada, and the US temporarily shut their embassies and issued travel advisories against Kenya.

nodes.description: 英国暂停对肯尼亚的所有航班运营一个月
nodes.support_text: The United Kingdom suspended flights to Kenya for a month.

nodes.description: 肯尼亚旅游业因恐怖袭击声誉受损，但最终恢复部分形象
nodes.support_text: Kenya eventually managed to shed the negative publicity that the bombing earned the tourism industry.

nodes.description: 恐怖分子抵达酒店入口
nodes.support_text: 恐怖分子抵达酒店入口

nodes.description: 三人曾到访酒店探望某人
nodes.support_text: 三人曾到访酒店探望某人

nodes.description: 守卫建议三人等待审批
nodes.support_text: 守卫建议三人等待审批
语义描述：两人驾车通过屏障

nodes.description: 两人驾车撞入酒店接待处
nodes.support_text: 语义描述：两人驾车撞入酒店接待处

nodes.description: 两人引爆车内装载的炸弹
nodes.support_text: 语义描述：两人引爆车内装载的炸弹

edges.support_text: By April 2002, the terrorists had singled out the targets.
Investigations by American, Israeli, and Kenyan intelligence service teams into the hotel bombing revealed that preparations for the attack had started a year earlier.
Over the next five months, the terrorists conducted video surveillance.
They made arrangements to smuggle two shoulder-fired Soviet-made SA-7B SAMs into Kenya from Yemen.
They packed the bombs into their SUV, which was bought on November 15, 2002.
Suddenly, one of the men jumped out, slipped under the barrier, and ran towards the reception desk, detonating explosives that were strapped to his body.
The terrorists assembled the bombs in a rented house in Tudor, Mombasa.
At 8.40am that day, other terrorists fired a missile at an Israeli Arkia Airlines jet as it took off from Mombasa’s Moi International Airport.
Australia, Britain, Canada, and the US temporarily shut their embassies and issued travel advisories against Kenya.
The United Kingdom suspended flights to Kenya for a month.
Kenya eventually managed to shed the negative publicity that the bombing earned the tourism industry.
两人驾车通过屏障后撞入酒店接待处
撞入酒店后引爆车内炸弹
